alert.note: Alert for Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:26PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Letcher, northeastern Perry, Knott and south central Breathitt Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 126 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fisty, or 7 miles northeast of Hazard, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fisty and Cordia around 130 PM EDT. Emmalena, Ritchie, Bearville and Elic around 135 PM EDT. Vicco, Carrie, Tina, Vest, Anco, Wiscoal and Sassafras around 140 PM EDT. Hindman and Yellow Mountain around 145 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Brinkley, Leburn, Garner, Amburgey, Soft Shell, Carr Creek, Smithsboro, Cody, Mallie, Ivis, Spider, Littcarr, Larkslane, Dirk, Redfox, Mousie, Bath, Pippa Passes, Pine Top, Hollybush and Amelia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
